Sentencas: Long-term performance stability is essential for the commercialization of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) technology.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: The performance degradations of SOFCs induced by the microstructure evolutions of cell component materials are examined by multi-physics numerical simulations.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: Explicit considerations are given to the typical material set: nickel (Ni) -
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: Yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) anode, YSZ electrolyte, and SS430 interconnect.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: Degradation of the Ni-YSZ anode is attributed to the agglomeration of Ni particles that results in a reduced three-phase-boundary length and a reduced electrical conductivity of the anode.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: Degradation of the SS430 interconnect is considered based on the growth of its oxide scale.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: The decreased conductivity of YSZ due to its phase transformation from cubic to tetragonal is the cause of degradation associated with the electrolyte.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: The simulations provide quantitatively the effects of the microstructure evolutions of the cell components on the cell performance.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions

Sentencas: It is concluded that the long-term stability required for the SOFC commercialization can be achieved through an anti-oxidation coating of SS430 and a proper choice of the initial anode compositions.
Titulo: Degradations of the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cell induced by material microstructure evolutions
